intro: Oenothera pallida var. idahoensis, commonly known as the Idaho evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds enclosed in a capsule, typical of the Onagraceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Oenothera pallida var. idahoensis is also noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators.
